description: A simple dish to prepare, the bright peas and asparagus contrast beautifully with the golden yolk of the egg.
name: Pea Pancakes Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1 bunch asparagus spears, woody ends removed

recipeInstructions.text: Put the fresh peas in a pan and blanch in boiling water for 1-2 minutes, then drain and leave to cool. Frozen peas will not need this step.
Put the peas and mint into a food processor and whizz to a rough texture. Add the butter, flour, cream, Parmesan, and 2 of the eggs, and season. Process once more to form a stiff paste.

Heat a little butter in a large frying pan and add a couple of tablespoonfuls of the mixture for each pancake. Cook over a medium heat and use the back of a spoon to smooth the top. After 3-4 minutes, the edges will change colour and show a brownish tinge. Carefully turn them over and cook for another couple of minutes.
Meanwhile, bring a large pan of water to the boil and lightly poach the remaining 4 eggs until just set. Remove them with a slotted spoon.

As the eggs are cooking, chargrill the asparagus on a hot griddle pan with the extra virgin olive oil, seasoning while cooking, until golden. Serve on warmed plates with the pancakes, carefully placing a poached egg on each serving.
